Posts.Content: Thanks for all your replies Age 60 New Zealand PSA from 5 - 16.1 over 7 years 3 months ago 17.1 6 month ago 14.5 Urine fine No symptoms 4 Biopsy to date 2 MRI 12mm lesion found There is mild associated diffusion restriction. This carries a PIRADS score of 4 and 4 others found with new higher definition MRI. MICRO Biopsy 1. Sections show a core of prostatic tissue containing a focus of five to six atypical small acini. These show nucleoli and appear to lack a basal staining with HMWCK/p63 however they lack racemase positivity. This focus is best regarded as representing atypical small acinar proliferation [ASAP]. 2. Sections show a core of prostatic tissue containing a focus of two atypical small acini. These show nucleoli and appear to lack a basal staining with HMWCK/p63 and show racemase positivity. This focus is best regarded as representing atypical small acinar proliferation [ASAP]. 3. - 12. Sections show cores of prostatic tissue; there is no evidence of high-grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia or malignancy. SUMMARY PROSTATE NEEDLE BIOPSIES SERIES - ATYPICAL SMALL ACINAR PROLIFERATION [ASAP] LEFT BASE
Posts.Title: biopsy psa and ASAP

Posts.Content: I was also wondering if anyone had experienced what I thought was described as a 'focused biopsy'? My specialist said something like: it's 12mm in 30 mm so we can't really miss it. Am paraphrasing. But when you look at the results of the last biopsy - they sampled all sectors and the only real variation seemed to be the depth/length of the cores - up to 20mm. I was kinda expecting around 4 cores in 1 section only - not 12 all around. Is this just my misunderstanding? Glenn
Posts.Title: biopsy psa and ASAP

Posts.Content: Just to follow up. Met the specialist today and he has suggested active monitoring as I think you all expected. I will come back if things change but am pretty pleased so far. Thanks for all the input; very much appreciated Glenn
Posts.Title: biopsy psa and ASAP

Posts.Content: Thanks to everyone again; it's very reassuring. I'll need to try to dig out the prostate size; I do recall the specialist commenting I may have a 'slow growing but benign' in the early days. My last PSA about 2 weeks ago had dropped to 16.7 and on a couple of occasions in the past it was lower than previous measures but the general trend seems to be up. Although - my first measures - around age 52 were still around 6. Glenn
Posts.Title: biopsy psa and ASAP

Posts.Content: Just to follow up. Met the specialist today and he has suggested active monitoring as I think you all expected. I will come back if things change but am pretty pleased so far. Thanks for all the input; very much appreciated Glenn
Posts.Title: biopsy psa and ASAP

Posts.Content: Hiya I've just had my fourth biopsy - about 6 or 7 years after the first. 4 have been standard - 12 - and the previous was a 20 or so. Each time the approach has been - we'll find it soon. This biopsy was prompted by psa around 16. An mri - my second - showed a 12mm lesion which 'will be easy to sample ' - but 2 cores show ASAP - again - and nothing else I have yet to go back for the follow up appointment but the surgeon was suggesting likely removal prior and I am now left wondering myself what a sensible next step might be? Glenn Ps am still researching the mimics but not sure if that is just wishful thinking

So I am checking before we meet next. Thanks for all the questions / info re the tests. I will find out what I can and post more then. Glenn
